Description.val: This program upgrades M1/M1A1 tanks to the M1A2 System Enhancement Package (SEP) configuration.  Therefore, for each M1A2 SEP produced, there was a corresponding decrease in the Army's M1/M1A1 inventory.  The Abrams Upgrade Program upgrades the tanks survivability, automotive power pack, computer systems, and night vision capabilities.  The M1A2 SEP has improved microprocessors, color flat panel displays, improved memory capacity, better Soldier-Machine Interface (SMI), and a new open operating system designed to run the Common Operating Environment (COE) software.  Both the Gunner's Primary Sight (GPS) and the Commander's Independent Thermal Viewer (CITV) on the M1A2 SEP tank include the improved thermal imaging capabilities of the Block I 2nd Generation Forward Looking Infra-Red (FLIR) technology.  The M1A2 SEP has improved frontal and side armor for enhanced crew survivability.  The M1A2 SEP is also equipped with the total integrated revitalization (TIGER) engine and upgraded transmission for improved automotive reliability and durability.  The Abrams Upgrade Program will continue to modify and upgrade the Abrams M1A2SEP v2 tank and mitigate risk to the Abrams tank industrial base.
